solution_line_template: First find the total time Melissa spends per shoe: {time_buckle_per_shoe} minutes + {time_heel_per_shoe} minutes = <<{time_buckle_per_shoe}+{time_heel_per_shoe}={total_time_per_shoe}>>{total_time_per_shoe} minutes
Then double that amount because there are {num_shoes} shoes: {total_time_per_shoe} minutes * {num_shoes} = <<{total_time_per_shoe}*{num_shoes}={total_project_time}>>{total_project_time} minutes
